msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.l:
And Moses went
and spoke these words to all
Israel.

And he said to them, ‘I am a hundred
twenty years old today. I will not be able to go out and come in anymore.
And the Lord has said to me, “You will not cross this Jordan.”

The divine Presence of the Lord your God: he is crossing
before you. He will destroy these nations
from before you, and you shall inherit them. Joshua: he is crossing
before you, as the Lord has spoken.

And the Lord will do
to them as he did to Sihon and to Og, kings
of the Amorites, and to their land, that he destroyed them.

And the Lord will give them up before you, and you shall do to them
according to all the commandments which I have commanded you.

Grow stronger and strengthen yourselves. Do not fear and do not be broken down
before them, because the help of the Lord your God: he is
the one who goes with you. He will not emaciate you and will not leave
you.’

And Moses called Joshua and said
to him in the sight of all Israel, ‘Grow stronger and strengthen yourself, because
you will go with this people to the land which the Lord has sworn
to them to give them, and you will put them in possession of it.

And the divine Presence of the Lord: he is the one who goes before you.
His help will be with you, he will not emaciate you and
will not leave you. You shall not fear and be broken down.’

And Moses wrote this Law and gave
it to the priests, sons of Levi, who were carrying
the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and to all the elders of
Israel.

And Moses commanded them, saying,
‘At the beginning of every seven years, in the set time of the year of remission,
at the feast of Sukkot,

When all Israel has come to appear
before the directions of Lord your God in the place which
he will choose, you shall read this Law in front of all
Israel in their ears.

Gather the
people together — the men and the women and the infants and
your stranger who is in your cities — that they may hear and that
they may learn and fear the Lord your God
and be watchful to do all the words of this Law.

And their children who have not known
may hear and learn to fear the Lord your God
all the days you are living on the land
to which you are crossing the Jordan to inherit
it.’

And the Lord said to Moses, ‘Lo,
your days to die have come close. Call Joshua
and stand up in the tent of meeting, that I may command him.’
And Moses and Joshua went and stood up in the tent of meeting.

And the divine Presence of the Lord appeared in the tent
in a pillar of cloud, and the pillar of cloud stood
over the door of the tent.

And
the Lord said to Moses, ‘Lo, you will lie down with your fathers,
and this people will rise up and go astray after the service
of foreign gods of the land into the midst of which it is coming,
and it will leave my service and break my covenant
which I have made with them.

And
my anger will be kindled at it on that day, and I will resign
from being gracious, and I will hide my directions from them, and
they will be |left| for being devoured, and many evils and troubles shall befall it.
And it will say on that day, “Lo, because
the divine Presence of my God is not present among me,
all these evils have befallen me.”

And I
will surely hide my directions in that day because of all the evils
which it has done, because it turned to the service of other gods.

So now write this song for yourselves
and teach it to the children of Israel.
Put it in their mouths, that this song may be a witness
for me against the children of Israel.

When I will bring it to the land which I swore
to their fathers, a land flowing |with| milk and honey, and it will eat and
be full and quench, and it will turn to the service of other
gods, and they will serve them, and they will annoy
me, and it will break my covenant,

Then
it shall be, when many evils and troubles will befall it,
this song shall testify before them as a witness, because
it shall not be forgotten from the mouths of their offspring. Because I know
its inclination that it is doing today, before I bring
it to the land which I swore.’

And Moses wrote
this song the same day and taught it
to the children of Israel.

And he commanded Joshua, son
of Nun, and said, ‘Grow stronger and strengthen yourself, because you will bring
the children of Israel to the land which I swore to them.
And my hep will be with you.’

And it was
when Moses had finished writing the words of this Law
on a scroll until they were finished,

And
Moses commanded the Levites, who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord,
saying,

to ‘Take this book of the Law,
and put it by the side of the ark of the covenant of the Lord
your God, that it may be there for you as a witness.

Because I know
your rebellion and your hard neck. Lo, while I am yet
alive with you today, you have been rebellious before the Lord,
and |you will be| all the more |so| after my death.

Gather
to me all the elders of your tribes and your overseers,
so I may speak these words in their ears
and call the skies and earth as witness regarding them.

Because I know that after my death you will utterly destroy
your ways and turn aside from the way which I have commanded you.
And evil will befall you in the latter days, because
you will do things that seem bad in the eyes of the Lord,
to annoy him with the work of your hands.’

And
Moses spoke in the ears of all the community of Israel the words
of this song until they were ended.
